result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis J Schmitt in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Travis J Schmitt in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 68 days served.

Court ordered the defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 11-19-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Francisco Araiza, defendant Travis J Schmitt not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Araiza is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Travis J Schmitt not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Pre-trial conference.  Defendant in custody; not produced.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Travis J Schmitt not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kien T. and Matthew N.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Travis J Schmitt in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Travis J Schmitt in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
